info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:32PM EDT until June 14 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF SCREVEN...BULLOCH AND EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 131 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Brooklet, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Statesboro, Springfield, Rincon, Guyton, Brooklet, Oliver, Register, Ebenezer, Egypt, Marlow, Shawnee, Stillwell, Nevils, Pineora and Georgia Southern. This warning includes I-16 between mile markers 119 and 138. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
